job_tasks.justification: This phrase directly refers to the act of writing software, a core component of software development.
Ensuring code quality is a standard practice within software development to maintain maintainable and robust codebases.
Developing and implementing best practices is crucial for efficient and high-quality software development.
Writing tests (e.g., unit tests, integration tests) is a fundamental part of the software development lifecycle.

job_tasks.phrase: manage the continuous integration of code
job_tasks.justification: Continuous Integration (CI) is a key practice in MLOps and software development for automating build and testing processes.
Supporting architects is part of the collaborative process in building software solutions.

job_tasks.phrase: technical point of contact for product owners and heads of tech
job_tasks.justification: Acting as a point of contact for business stakeholders indicates an understanding of business needs and communication between technical and product teams.

job_tasks.phrase: guiding other back- and front-end developers in developing a feature-rich product
job_tasks.justification: Guiding other developers in product development falls under leadership and execution in software development.
Technical scaling of services is a core concern in designing and developing robust software systems.

job_tasks.phrase: combine best agile development practices in combination with a services-based architecture
job_tasks.justification: Implementing agile practices and service-based architecture are software development methodologies and architectural patterns.

job_tasks.phrase: Are an expert on 'your' domain (Kotlin back-end services on our Azure Kubernetes platform), though you can also liaise with other senior engineers and their respective technologies (Front and Back End).
job_tasks.justification: Expertise in a specific domain and the ability to liaise with others across technologies implies understanding business context and technical landscape.

job_tasks.phrase: using Azure and Microservices, Kubernetes, CI/CD pipelines
job_tasks.justification: These are all integral components of modern software development and deployment practices.

job_tasks.phrase: put things live straight away, hence reduce our time to market
job_tasks.justification: Focusing on rapid deployment and time-to-market is a key objective in software development.

job_tasks.phrase: impact on the direction of the (technical) part of the app
job_tasks.justification: Having an impact on the direction indicates a role in shaping the product and its technical strategy, which is business-aligned.

job_tasks.phrase: share knowledge and best practices with other teams
job_tasks.justification: Sharing knowledge and best practices is part of fostering a strong development culture and improving overall software engineering.

soft_skills.phrase: contribute to the AH Tech community via Guilds, inner source initiatives, and more.
technical point of contact for product owners and heads of tech
Are the Lead software engineer, guiding other back- and front-end developers
have an impact on the direction of the (technical) part of the app
encourage you to share knowledge and best practices with other teams
Understand how to technically scale the services
Understand how to combine best agile development practices in combination with a services-based architecture

classification.rationale: The job description heavily emphasizes traditional software engineering practices, leadership, and infrastructure management using technologies like Kotlin, Azure, and Kubernetes. There is no mention of Generative AI models, LLMs, RAG, or fine-tuning, which are core to the GenAI Engineer profile. It is a senior software engineering role focused on building and scaling applications.
